decks.notes: This Death & Taxes deck focuses on disrupting opponents with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Wasteland while using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. Key cards like Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull provide additional threats and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies while building up its own board presence with efficient creatures and equipment. The combination of aggro pressure and disruptive elements makes this deck a strong contender in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Death's Shadow as a large threat by manipulating your life total using cards like Street Wraith and Fetch lands. The deck aims to disrupt your opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while also being able to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out. The deck also has a fast clock with Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Mana Leak, Spell Pierce, Daze, and Force of Will, while also deploying threats like Stoneforge Mystic, True-Name Nemesis, and Delver of Secrets. The deck can generate value with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage, and can also gain life and create tempo swings with Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The mana base is designed to support all the color requirements and utilize Wasteland for land disruption.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures at a rapid pace, using cards like Eldrazi Mimic, Matter Reshaper, Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Endbringer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Warping Wail to control the opponent's spells. The deck takes advantage of mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb to quickly deploy threats. Additionally, Mishra's Factory and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional utility and versatility in combat situations.

Control deck with a strong focus on disruption and removal spells, backed up by card advantage and efficient threats. The deck aims to disrupt opponent's game plan through counterspells, discard spells, and removal, while generating card advantage through card selection and card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The goal is to control the board and the opponent's resources until the deck can establish a dominant position and close out the game with powerful spells like Toxic Deluge or Vindicate.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining control of the game through a combination of removal, hand disruption, and card advantage. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Kolaghan's Command, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep them on the back foot. Additionally, the deck includes powerful threats like Gurmag Angler, Baleful Strix, and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Young Pyromancer while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember, and card selection with cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. With a mana denial strategy thanks to cards like Wasteland and disruption from cards like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port while utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful threats. Life from the Loam is used to recur lands from the graveyard, maintaining card advantage and fueling the engine. Crop Rotation and Gamble provide additional ways to search for key lands or cards. Overall, the deck seeks to lock down the game with its land-based control strategy.

This Legacy Control-Loam deck focuses on utilizing Life from the Loam to recur lands and fuel graveyard synergies, while also utilizing powerful disruption in the form of cards like Chalice of the Void and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to control the game by disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Punishing Fire, while also applying pressure with creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant. The deck's strategy revolves around resource denial, efficient removal, and card advantage to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a long game.

This deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing the graveyard recursion and land synergies of the Loam archetype. By utilizing cards like Life from the Loam, Punishing Fire, and Green Sun's Zenith, the deck aims to control the board through resource denial and efficient threats. The inclusion of powerful utility lands like Karakas and Dark Depths, as well as versatile creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Titania, Protector of Argoth, allows for flexibility in dealing with a variety of matchups.

The key concept of this UWx Control deck is centered around maximizing card advantage and control through counterspells, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and card draw spells. The strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently drawing into answers and threats of your own. This deck aims to outvalue the opponent by gaining incremental advantages through cards like Accumulated Knowledge and Snapcaster Mage, while also controlling the board with cards like Terminus and Council's Judgment. Jace, the Mind Sculptor serves as a powerful win condition and card advantage engine in longer games.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by continuously disrupting the opponent's resources and preventing them from developing their board. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, Sinkhole, and Smallpox, the deck aims to strip the opponent's hand, destroy their lands, and sacrifice their creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Ensnaring Bridge to further hinder the opponent's ability to play creatures and attack. Ultimately, the goal is to grind out the opponent and secure victory through attrition and resource denial.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then use reanimation spells such as Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring them back onto the battlefield. The deck aims to cheat out big threats like Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Tidespout Tyrant early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask provide disruption by stripping key cards from the opponent's hand, allowing the reanimated creatures to push through for the win.

The deck focuses on quickly and efficiently getting out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using the combo of Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. With the help of cards like Omniscience and Lotus Petal, it can cheat these creatures into play for a game-ending impact. The deck also includes cards like Force of Will and Cunning Wish for protection and versatility. It combines fast mana with powerful combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and win the game swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and rituals, and then utilize spells like Infernal Tutor and Dark Petition to search for and play key combo pieces such as Tendrils of Agony. The deck is designed to set up an explosive turn where multiple spells are cast in succession, culminating in a lethal Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in one big storm of spells. The deck focuses on efficient mana production and card selection to maximize the chances of a successful combo finish.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and Glimmerpost to power out big threats like Primeval Titan and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. Crop Rotation and Expedition Map help find the necessary lands, while Show and Tell can cheat out these threats early. The deck also includes disruption like Abrupt Decay and Pithing Needle to control the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and outvalue them with efficient land searching and ramping.
